oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter of John Chamberlain to Sir Dudley Carleton
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Chamberlain, John
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Theater--England--London--History--17th century
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: John Chamberlain (1553-1628) was a professional letter-writer employed by contemporaries who preserved his letters in considerable numbers. Chief among his employers was Sir Dudley Carleton (1574-1632), Viscount Dorchester, a career diplomat who served in Venice from 1610 to 1615. (Carleton was admitted to Gray's Inn in 1605). This letter, dated 23 December 1613, describes the preparations for events for the wedding of Lady Francis Howard and Robert Kerr.
